channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Generalizable Person Re-identification via Balancing Alignment and Uniformity
item.description: To address this issue, we propose a novel framework, Balancing Alignment and Uniformity (BAU), which effectively mitigates this effect by maintaining a balance between alignment and uniformity.

item.title: Relational Contrastive Learning and Masked Image Modeling for Scene Text Recognition
item.description: Based on this, we further conduct relational contrastive learning to model the intra- and inter-hierarchical relations for frames, sub-words and words. On the other hand, MIM can naturally boost the context information via masking, where we find that the block masking strategy is more effective for STR.

item.title: Noise Filtering Benchmark for Neuromorphic Satellites Observations
item.description: Additionally, we introduce a new high-resolution satellite dataset with ground truth from a real-world platform under various noise conditions, which we have made publicly available.

item.title: Cuvis.Ai: An Open-Source, Low-Code Software Ecosystem for Hyperspectral Processing and Classification
item.description: Machine learning is an important tool for analyzing high-dimension hyperspectral data; however, existing software solutions are either closed-source or inextensible research products.

item.title: Semantic-Geometric-Physical-Driven Robot Manipulation Skill Transfer via Skill Library and Tactile Representation
item.description: The framework hierarchically organizes operational knowledge by constructing a "task graph" and a "scene graph" to represent task and scene semantic information, respectively.

item.title: Aligning Few-Step Diffusion Models with Dense Reward Difference Learning
item.description: Experimental results demonstrate that SDPO consistently outperforms prior methods in reward-based alignment across diverse step configurations, underscoring its robust step generalization capabilities.

item.title: Equivariant spatio-hemispherical networks for diffusion MRI deconvolution
item.description: Each voxel in a diffusion MRI (dMRI) image contains a spherical signal corresponding to the direction and strength of water diffusion in the brain.

item.title: ZeFaV: Boosting Large Language Models for Zero-shot Fact Verification
item.description: In this paper, we propose ZeFaV - a zero-shot based fact-checking verification framework to enhance the performance on fact verification task of large language models by leveraging the in-context learning ability of large language models to extract the relations among the entities within a claim, re-organized the information from the evidence in a relationally logical form, and combine the above information with the original evidence to generate the context from which our fact-checking model provide verdicts for the input claims.

item.title: Graph Artificial Intelligence for Quantifying Compatibility Mechanisms in Traditional Chinese Medicine
item.description: Traditional Chinese Medicine (TCM) involves complex compatibility mechanisms characterized by multi-component and multi-target interactions, which are challenging to quantify.

item.title: Lifted Model Construction without Normalisation: A Vectorised Approach to Exploit Symmetries in Factor Graphs
item.description: Lifted probabilistic inference exploits symmetries in a probabilistic model to allow for tractable probabilistic inference with respect to domain sizes of logical variables.

item.title: Color-Oriented Redundancy Reduction in Dataset Distillation
item.description: At the image level, we employ a palette network, a specialized neural network, to dynamically allocate colors from a reduced color space to each pixel.

item.title: Real-Time Fitness Exercise Classification and Counting from Video Frames
item.description: The model was trained and validated on these diverse datasets, achieving an accuracy of over 99% on the test set.

item.title: CCExpert: Advancing MLLM Capability in Remote Sensing Change Captioning with Difference-Aware Integration and a Foundational Dataset
item.description: In this paper, we propose a novel model, CCExpert, based on a new, advanced multimodal large model framework.

item.title: ST-Tree with Interpretability for Multivariate Time Series Classification
item.description: However, deep neural network models such as Transformers exhibit high accuracy in multivariate time series classification but lack interpretability and fail to provide insights into the decision-making process.

item.title: SADDE: Semi-supervised Anomaly Detection with Dependable Explanations
item.description: In this research paper, we introduce SADDE, a general framework designed to accomplish two primary objectives: (1) to render the anomaly detection process interpretable and enhance the credibility of interpretation outcomes, and (2) to assign high-confidence pseudo labels to unlabeled samples, thereby boosting the performance of anomaly detection systems when supervised data is scarce.

item.title: Visual-Semantic Graph Matching Net for Zero-Shot Learning
item.description: However, methods trained under this paradigm often struggle to learn robust embedding space because they align the two modalities in an isolated manner among classes, which ignore the crucial class relationship during the alignment process.

item.title: Edge-Enhanced Dilated Residual Attention Network for Multimodal Medical Image Fusion
item.description: Multimodal medical image fusion is a crucial task that combines complementary information from different imaging modalities into a unified representation, thereby enhancing diagnostic accuracy and treatment planning.

item.title: TS-LLaVA: Constructing Visual Tokens through Thumbnail-and-Sampling for Training-Free Video Large Language Models
item.description: For video understanding tasks, training-based video LLMs are difficult to build due to the scarcity of high-quality, curated video-text paired data.

item.title: Dialectal Toxicity Detection: Evaluating LLM-as-a-Judge Consistency Across Language Varieties
item.description: However, if we have to rank the consistency, the weakest area is LLM-human agreement, followed by dialectal consistency.

item.title: VeGaS: Video Gaussian Splatting
item.description: One potential solution is to use a 3D Gaussian Splatting (3DGS) based model, such as the Video Gaussian Representation (VGR), which is capable of encoding video as a multitude of 3D Gaussians and is applicable for numerous video processing operations, including editing.

item.title: Improving User Experience in Preference-Based Optimization of Reward Functions for Assistive Robots
item.description: Assistive robots interact with humans and must adapt to different users' preferences to be effective.

item.title: From Primes to Paths: Enabling Fast Multi-Relational Graph Analysis
item.description: This enables a compact representation of a complete multi-relational graph using a single adjacency matrix, which, in turn, facilitates quick computation of multi-hop adjacency matrices.

item.title: BianCang: A Traditional Chinese Medicine Large Language Model
item.description: The rise of large language models (LLMs) has driven significant progress in medical applications, including traditional Chinese medicine (TCM).

item.title: Understanding Multimodal LLMs: the Mechanistic Interpretability of Llava in Visual Question Answering
item.description: Understanding the mechanisms behind Large Language Models (LLMs) is crucial for designing improved models and strategies.

item.title: Exploring Neural Joint Activity in Spiking Neural Networks for Fraud Detection
item.description: Our proposed SNN approach with neural joint activity enables the classification of fraudulent opening of bank accounts more accurately and fairly than standard SNNs.

item.title: Variational Bayesian Bow tie Neural Networks with Shrinkage
item.description: Despite the dominant role of deep models in machine learning, limitations persist, including overconfident predictions, susceptibility to adversarial attacks, and underestimation of variability in predictions.

item.title: SageAttention2 Technical Report: Accurate 4 Bit Attention for Plug-and-play Inference Acceleration
item.description: Second, we propose a method to smooth $Q$ and $V$, enhancing the accuracy of attention with INT4 $QK$ and FP8 $PV$.

item.title: StableV2V: Stablizing Shape Consistency in Video-to-Video Editing
item.description: Recent advancements of generative AI have significantly promoted content creation and editing, where prevailing studies further extend this exciting progress to video editing.

item.title: Conformation Generation using Transformer Flows
item.description: Fast generation of valid conformations is thus central to molecular modeling.

item.title: Going Beyond Conventional OOD Detection
item.description: In this work, we present a unified Approach to Spurious, fine-grained, and Conventional OOD Detection (ASCOOD).

item.title: Diffusion-based Layer-wise Semantic Reconstruction for Unsupervised Out-of-Distribution Detection
item.description: The innovation of our approach is that we leverage the diffusion model's intrinsic data reconstruction ability to distinguish ID samples from OOD samples in the latent feature space.

item.title: GeomCLIP: Contrastive Geometry-Text Pre-training for Molecules
item.description: Based on this dataset, we propose the GeomCLIP framework to enhance for multi-modal representation learning from molecular structures and biomedical text.

item.title: SAM Decoding: Speculative Decoding via Suffix Automaton
item.description: SAM-Decoding constructs static and dynamic suffix automatons for the text corpus and input prompts, respectively, enabling fast and precise draft generation.

item.title: Underwater Image Enhancement with Cascaded Contrastive Learning
item.description: In this paper, we propose to address this issue by designing a two-stage deep learning framework and taking advantage of cascaded contrastive learning to guide the network training of each stage.

item.title: ChannelDropBack: Forward-Consistent Stochastic Regularization for Deep Networks
item.description: As a consequence, it allows for seamless integration into the training process of any model and layers without the need to change its architecture, making it applicable to various network topologies, and the exact same network is deployed during training and inference.

item.title: Awaker2.5-VL: Stably Scaling MLLMs with Parameter-Efficient Mixture of Experts
item.description: As the research of Multimodal Large Language Models (MLLMs) becomes popular, an advancing MLLM model is typically required to handle various textual and visual tasks (e. g., VQA, Detection, OCR, and ChartQA) simultaneously for real-world applications.

item.title: Improvement in Facial Emotion Recognition using Synthetic Data Generated by Diffusion Model
item.description: In this paper, we tackle the issue of data imbalance by incorporating synthetic data augmentation and leveraging the ResEmoteNet model to enhance the overall performance on facial emotion recognition task.

item.title: Improving Fraud Detection with 1D-Convolutional Spiking Neural Networks Through Bayesian Optimization
item.description: Our approach consists of applying 1D-Convolutional Spiking Neural Networks to improve fraud detection on the Bank Account Fraud dataset with the Bayesian optimization of hyperparameters.

item.title: Revealing the Evolution of Order in Materials Microstructures Using Multi-Modal Computer Vision
item.description: The development of high-performance materials for microelectronics, energy storage, and extreme environments depends on our ability to describe and direct property-defining microstructural order.

item.title: Modification Takes Courage: Seamless Image Stitching via Reference-Driven Inpainting
item.description: Current image stitching methods often produce noticeable seams in challenging scenarios such as uneven hue and large parallax.

item.title: USP-Gaussian: Unifying Spike-based Image Reconstruction, Pose Correction and Gaussian Splatting
item.description: Leveraging the multi-view consistency afforded by 3DGS and the motion capture capability of the spike camera, our framework enables a joint iterative optimization that seamlessly integrates information between the spike-to-image network and 3DGS.

item.title: Federated Domain Generalization via Prompt Learning and Aggregation
item.description: Specifically, we propose a novel FedDG framework through Prompt Learning and AggregatioN (PLAN), which comprises two training stages to collaboratively generate local prompts and global prompts at each federated round.

item.title: SEAGULL: No-reference Image Quality Assessment for Regions of Interest via Vision-Language Instruction Tuning
item.description: The quality analysis of ROIs can provide fine-grained guidance for image quality improvement and is crucial for scenarios focusing on region-level quality.

item.title: Mitigating Sycophancy in Decoder-Only Transformer Architectures: Synthetic Data Intervention
item.description: To address the sycophancy problem caused by reinforcement learning from human feedback in large language models, this research applies synthetic data intervention technology to the decoder-only transformer architecture.

item.title: Zero-shot Voice Conversion with Diffusion Transformers
item.description: Zero-shot voice conversion aims to transform a source speech utterance to match the timbre of a reference speech from an unseen speaker.

item.title: Embedding Byzantine Fault Tolerance into Federated Learning via Virtual Data-Driven Consistency Scoring Plugin
item.description: By utilizing this scoring mechanism before the aggregation phase, the proposed plugin enables existing FL techniques to become robust against Byzantine attacks while maintaining their original benefits.

item.title: ScribbleVS: Scribble-Supervised Medical Image Segmentation via Dynamic Competitive Pseudo Label Selection
item.description: In clinical medicine, precise image segmentation can provide substantial support to clinicians.

item.title: The Dawn of GUI Agent: A Preliminary Case Study with Claude 3.5 Computer Use
item.description: The recently released model, Claude 3. 5 Computer Use, stands out as the first frontier AI model to offer computer use in public beta as a graphical user interface (GUI) agent.

item.title: Evaluating Creativity and Deception in Large Language Models: A Simulation Framework for Multi-Agent Balderdash
item.description: This paper introduces a simulation framework utilizing the game Balderdash to evaluate both the creativity and logical reasoning of LLMs.

item.title: Model Inversion Attacks: A Survey of Approaches and Countermeasures
item.description: These attacks highlight the vulnerability of neural networks and raise awareness about the risk of privacy leakage within the research community.
